medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Obesity developed in the second year of life, with hyperphagia leading to increased food intake. The patient experienced neonatal onset enteropathy characterized by persistent diarrhea that started on the eighth postnatal day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Neonatal onset enteropathy with generalized malabsorption, persistent diarrhea, elevated fasting plasma levels of proinsulin, and obesity. No history of reactive hypoglycemia.
medical_history.family_history: Consanguineous parents of Libyan origin; both parents were heterozygous for the Ser307Leu mutation but were not obese.
